author: Special Correspondent
text:
Farmers will meet in Thanjavur on Saturday to decide on the future course of action, following the police attack on G. Balan, a farmer of Cholagankudikadu in Thanjavur district.

Addressing a press conference here on Friday, P. R. Pandian, president, Tamil Nadu Federation of All Farmers’ Associations, said that he had submitted a petition to the Chief Electoral Officer, Rajesh B. Lakhoni, seeking action against the police personnel responsible for the attack on Balan for loan default. He wanted the government to immediately stop all distraint proceedings against farmers, pay a compensation of Rs.10 lakh for Balan and blacklist Kotak Mahindra Bank for violating the Reserve Bank of India’s guidelines for collection of loan dues.

Mr. Pandian warned that political parties should not use farmers as mere votebank. “All parties should take responsibility for the incident. We shall not hesitate to boycott the forthcoming Assembly election,” he said and added that farmers would meet in Thanjavur on Saturday to decide the action plan. He appealed to the Tamil Nadu unit of the Bharatiya Janata Party to take up the issue with the Central leaders for appropriate action against Kotak Mahindra Bank.
title: Attack on Balan: farmers to meet today
